children.name: contextID
children.text2: Sys_id of the activity execution in which to add the optional activity. To access, click the process listed in the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table. The execution selected must be in a state of In Progress.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the activity was successfully scheduled to run.
Valid values:
  • true: Activity is successfully scheduled to run. The output is a string stating success.
  • false: Activity isn't successfully scheduled to run. The output is an array of one or more error messages.

If errors, list of one or more error messages. Message stating Array of 0 or more elements otherwise.

children.name: Output
children.text:
success: boolean = true
errors: Array of 0 elements

children.name: Example
children.text: var contextId = '<context_id>'; var optionalActivityId = '<optional_activity_id>'; var where = 'WITH'; // options AFTER, WITH var relativeToId = '<relative_activity_context_id>'; // relative activity context ID var response = sn_pad.PDAutomationProvider.addOptionalActivityRelativeToActivityContext(contextId, optionalActivityId, where, relativeToId); gs.info(JSUtil.describeObject(response));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to run an optional activity simultaneously with the
        relative activity context.

children.name: activityId
children.text2:
Sys_id of the optional activity listed in the Activities [sys_pd_activity] table.
Note: To create an optional activity, it must have the Start rule set to Manual in the Activities [sys_pd_activity] table.

children.name: Array
children.text:
If errors, list of one or more error messages. Message stating Array of 0 or more elements otherwise.
Possible error messages:
  • Invalid Optional activity Id – The sys_id provided for the activityId parameter is invalid.
  • Invalid PD context Id – The Process Designer (PD) sys_id provided in the contextID parameter is invalid.
  • Invalid position type – The position type provided is invalid. See the description of the where parameter for valid types.
  • Invalid Relative-to Id – The sys_id provided for the relativeToId parameter is invalid.
  • Optional activity not found – The sys_id provided for the activityId parameter wasn't found.
  • Process must still be active – The process containing this activity must be active to run the optional activity.
  • Relative activity context not found – The sys_id provided for the relativeToId parameter was not found.

children.name: where
children.text2:
Indicates where to place the activity in the process.
Valid values:
  • AFTER – Execute this activity after the relative activity context.
  • WITH – Execute the activity at the same time as another relative activity context.

children.name: relativeToId
children.text2:
ID of the relative activity context that the optional activity will run after
                or with. Listed in the Activity Context [sys_pd_activity_context] table.

children.name: addOptionalActivityRelativeToActivityContext(String contextID, String activityId, String where, String relativeToId)
children.text:
Adds a specified optional activity to a process to be run relative to another activity
    during process execution.
children.text2: An activity context is created for each activity when a process executes. The context also handles how the activity handles execution. For information, see Process Automation Designer lanes and activities.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the activity was successfully scheduled to run.
Valid values:
  • true: Activity is successfully scheduled to run. The output is a string stating success.
  • false: Activity isn't successfully scheduled to run. The output is an array of one or more error messages.

children.name: contextID
children.text2: Sys_id of the activity execution in which to add the optional activity. To access, click the process listed in the Process Executions [sys_pd_context] table. The execution selected must be in a state of In Progress.

children.name: Output
children.text:
success: boolean = true
errors: Array of 0 elements

children.name: Example
children.text: var contextId = '<context_id>'; var optionalActivityId = '<optional_activity_id>'; var where = 'LAST'; // options LAST, NEXT var relativeToId = '<relative_lane_context_id>'; // relative lane context ID var response = sn_pad.PDAutomationProvider.addOptionalActivityRelativeToLaneContext(contextId, optionalActivityId, where, relativeToId); gs.info(JSUtil.describeObject(response));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to run an optional activity as the final activity in a lane
        context.

children.name: Array
children.text:
If errors, list of one or more error messages. Message stating Array of 0 or more elements otherwise.
Possible error messages:
  • Invalid Optional activity Id – The sys_id provided for the activityId parameter is invalid.
  • Invalid PD context Id – The Process Designer (PD) sys_id provided in the contextID parameter is invalid.
  • Invalid position type – The position type provided is invalid. See the description of the where parameter for valid types.
  • Invalid Relative-to Id – The sys_id provided for the relativeToId parameter is invalid.
  • Optional activity cannot be added to lane – The optional activity provided in the activityId parameter can't be added relative to the lane provided in the relativeToId parameter. Make sure that the Activity Execution selected is in the In Progress state.
  • Optional activity not found – The sys_id provided for the activityId parameter wasn't found.
  • Process must still be active – The process containing this activity must be active to run the optional activity.
  • Relative lane context not found – The sys_id provided for the relativeToId parameter was not found.

children.name: activityId
children.text2:
Sys_id of the optional activity listed in the Activities [sys_pd_activity] table.
Note: To create an optional activity, it must have the Start rule set to Manual in the Activities [sys_pd_activity] table.

children.name: where
children.text2:
Indicates where to place the activity in the process.
Valid values:
  • LAST – Execute as the final activity in a lane context.
  • NEXT – Execute in the next activity in a lane context.

children.name: relativeToId
children.text2:
ID of the relative lane context in which the optional activity is to run.
                Listed in the Lane Context [sys_pd_lane_context] table.

children.name: addOptionalActivityRelativeToLaneContext(String contextID, String activityId, String where, String relativeToId)
children.text:
Assigns an optional activity to a lane to run during that lane’s execution
    context.
children.text2: A lane context is created for each lane when a process executes. The context also handles how the lane handles execution. For information, see Process Automation Designer lanes and activities.

name: PDAutomationProvider API
text:
This API enables inserting an optional activity into a process while it's
    executing.
text2:
The PDAutomationProvider API is part of the Process Automation Designer plugin (com.glide.pad.core). This API is provided within the sn_pad namespace.

Calling scripts with this API requires at least one of the following:
  • The caller must be in the same scope in which the optional activity trigger was created.
  • Admin privileges.


A process is a series of activities ordered by lanes. An optional activity is predefined during process design. The activities aren't scheduled to run at a precise time. An activity can be assigned to a lane and made available to run during lane execution. An activity can be assigned to a process and made available to run during lane execution.

To create an optional activity, it must have the Start rule set to Manual in the Activities [sys_pd_activity] table. Process Automation Designer doesn't currently support creating manual activities.

An agent adds the optional activity to a lane or activity relative to another activity. The process must be running to insert an optional activity.

See also:
  • Design an automated process
  • Process Automation Designer lanes and activities
